meanings.definition: In a manner that is out of chronological order or time
meanings.sent1: She placed the ancient artifact anachronistically on the modern table.
meanings.sent2: The historian mistakenly dated the event anachronistically.
meanings.sent3: The time-traveler anachronistically wore a toga to the futuristic party.
meanings.sent4: Her outdated beliefs clashed anachronistically with the modern world.
meanings.sent5: The clock in the movie was ticking anachronistically, adding to the suspense.

meanings.definition: Using something that is not in its correct historical or chronological context
meanings.sent1: The anachronistically dressed actor stood out in the period drama.
meanings.sent2: The anachronistically designed building looked out of place in the city.
meanings.sent3: The anachronistically themed restaurant served medieval dishes with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Her anachronistically decorated room felt like a time machine.
meanings.sent5: The anachronistically styled car turned heads on the street.
